channel.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
channel.description:
I'm told that at least one person has expressed interest in contributing to this project. That's fine.
Feel free to fork the project and contribute changes via the pull request mechanism. Keep each pull request's changes concise and related to one thing. If they're reasonable then I'll review them and include them in the main branch.
I'm developing this in my own time, at my own leisure, so no rushing or hassling me.
[url=https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded]https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded[/url]
Project has been converted to use the Maven build system. Continuous integration now in place: https://travis-ci.org/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded

item.dc:creator: @da_real_hype da real hype
item.description:

Zach Knight (RIP) had an elysium source, he saw potential in it. I like where you’re going.
[/quote]

I actually have his source and it’s not elysium, but does have some components of it :P[/quote]

He had many sources, and his elysium source only had walking done.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

imthenull:

RSCD was not designed to be multithreaded. such would require a huge overhaul of the source. as i said before, it’s not a good design choice. at all.

Sure it wasn’t, it barely works in single threaded environment. lol. If you know what you are doing and you know bunch about concurrency it wouldn’t take long get RSCD working with it.

I shall repeat myself:

-Nothing:

I meant it would be best for usability.

Not everyone can be bothered to write thousands of lines when you can write hundred.

EDIT: And this thread is not about RSCD, so if you want to talk about making script system for RSCD make another topic. Elysium is in early stages and anything can be done.

EDIT2: There’s not many things that the ‘script’ threads needs to be using concurrently with the main thread. It is mainly just setting off client updates and modifying inventory.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

RSCD was not designed to be multithreaded. such would require a huge overhaul of the source. as i said before, it’s not a good design choice. at all.

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:27, topic:549463”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=668364.msg4470852#msg4470852 date=1422829383]
so far the best solution for that has been short lived threads per script which get killed after script is done.
[/quote]thats a horrible solution. the original system would be a million times better than this namely because you won’t have any concurrency issues, which are a bitch to deal with[/quote]
Only if you don’t know how to deal with them. Also I meant it would be best for usability.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:24, topic:549463”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=668364.msg4470802#msg4470802 date=1422813075]

Check out the new script manager:
https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded/tree/master/src/main/java/org/moparscape/elysium/script

The idiom for writing a script is quite simple:

        ScriptManager.registerItemOnItemScript(1, 1, ScriptManager.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
                (player, itemA, itemB) -> {
                    // Perform your task here.

                    // Return true to indicate that other scripts for this event, if they exist, should run.
                    // Return false if execution of scripts for this event should terminate.
                    return true;
                });

How are you going to do delays on scripts, e.g dialogues?
[/quote]Schedulers.

EDIT: Do you plan on putting this under some sort of license?[/quote]
Example? Using anything like what RSCD currently has needs to be ditched. You should be able to delay the script by 1 line and so far the best solution for that has been short lived threads per script which get killed after script is done.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m still thinking about how to do npc dialogue. That’s a tricky one because I don’t want my solution to involve n levels of nesting like the current approach does.

I’ll add a licence file this afternoon. It’ll probably be GPLv3 or the BSD/MIT licence.
What it won’t be is AGPL or similar where someone is compelled under licence to provide the source of any changes they make if they host those changes. It’s not like I have the financial capacity to enforce an AGPL licence anyway.

I’ll also add a readme.

And I use XML because it was there ready to copy and paste from the RSCD project. In my opinion there’s no reason to get caught up on how the entity data is stored at this point. In the future items and npcs will come from the database though, not from file.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:23, topic:549463"][quote author=Lothy link=topic=668364.msg4470560#msg4470560 date=1422698661]
Check out the new script manager:
https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded/tree/master/src/main/java/org/moparscape/elysium/script

The idiom for writing a script is quite simple:

        ScriptManager.registerItemOnItemScript(1, 1, ScriptManager.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
                (player, itemA, itemB) -> {
                    // Perform your task here.

                    // Return true to indicate that other scripts for this event, if they exist, should run.
                    // Return false if execution of scripts for this event should terminate.
                    return true;
                });

[/quote]
How are you going to do delays on scripts, e.g dialogues?[/quote]Schedulers.

EDIT: Do you plan on putting this under some sort of license?

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:17, topic:549463”]Check out the new script manager:
https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded/tree/master/src/main/java/org/moparscape/elysium/script

The idiom for writing a script is quite simple:

[code]
ScriptManager.registerItemOnItemScript(1, 1, ScriptManager.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
(player, itemA, itemB) -> {
// Perform your task here.

                // Return true to indicate that other scripts for this event, if they exist, should run.
                // Return false if execution of scripts for this event should terminate.
                return true;
            });

[/code][/quote]
How are you going to do delays on scripts, e.g dialogues?

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Is there any reason you’re using XML or would you be willing to move to JSON? Also you should consider writing out a README.md with some explanations on the goals of the projects and design decisions if you want more people to contribute. You should add a clear explanation on things like which client to use and such as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think you’re missing the point. The reason for a scripting system like this is so you don’t feel the need to wind up with one massive file that contains everything.
Additionally, when implementing something such as a quest, all of the scripts for that particular quest can go in one file (or package, if the quest is substantial enough).

Yeah, it’s new. I did write it yesterday, after all.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Which depends on the stage of the quest, if it doesn’t exist there is no reason to prioritize it. This stoof is new to rsc scene brah.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:18, topic:549463”]Can you explain the use of priorities?[/quote]It looks pretty simple. Scripts execute in an order indicated by the integer priority until one of the handlers return false. For example if you had a quest item that has a special action during said quest, you’d give it the highest priority.

Read full topic

The idiom for writing a script is quite simple:

        ScriptManager.registerItemOnItemScript(1, 1, ScriptManager.PRIORITY_DEFAULT,
                (player, itemA, itemB) -> {
                    // Perform your task here.

                    // Return true to indicate that other scripts for this event, if they exist, should run.

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:549463”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=668364.msg4470343#msg4470343 date=1422634694]
It would be really interesting to modularize the project, with such things as a log in server, data server (for, example, loading npc/object/etc locations), friend server (might be redundant, as this could be implemented into a log in server). Of course, all of this should be completely optional to the people using the software.
[/quote]
When has anyone ever had the infrastructure to justify splitting up services? At best people have one dedicated server. What you’ve described was considered the holy grail by a few of us years ago. In reality it’s a waste of energy.

Yes I consider it spoon feeding.

Nobody forced you to post your elite code mang. I suggest you read up on spoon feeding, or by suggesting that… I am spoon feeding? Anyways, you going to post those upgrades (you don’t have to go into any detail, just a general list, you can even pm this to lothy)

The walk to actions are using timed events to check if player is on the destination(it never crossed anybodys mind to check for that after moving the player?) :palm:. I don’t have enough time right now to list up more.

Fair point. However checking for that after moving means you’re coupling the event to the player/npc, rather than making it independent. Still, it’s worth consideration and you mentioning it is an eye-opener.

Just so you know, decoupling RSCD from MINA and making use of Netty instead is a lot of work in its own right. Changing the way packets are written to the underlying socket is the same (i.e., from immediately writing each small packet to instead using one large pooled underlying buffer and then flushing it once per tick).[/quote]
I am aware, but I have done it so many times that I could do it with my eyes closed. Netty 4.0(?) had this feature where you can write and flush at different times.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:549463”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=668364.msg4470343#msg4470343 date=1422634694]
It would be really interesting to modularize the project, with such things as a log in server, data server (for, example, loading npc/object/etc locations), friend server (might be redundant, as this could be implemented into a log in server). Of course, all of this should be completely optional to the people using the software.
[/quote]
When has anyone ever had the infrastructure to justify splitting up services? At best people have one dedicated server. What you’ve described was considered the holy grail by a few of us years ago. In reality it’s a waste of energy.[/quote]Sure it might not be utilized, but it would still make for a cool project. I’m just here to have fun

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

imthenull:

It would be really interesting to modularize the project, with such things as a log in server, data server (for, example, loading npc/object/etc locations), friend server (might be redundant, as this could be implemented into a log in server). Of course, all of this should be completely optional to the people using the software.

When has anyone ever had the infrastructure to justify splitting up services? At best people have one dedicated server. What you’ve described was considered the holy grail by a few of us years ago. In reality it’s a waste of energy.

[quote="-Nothing, post:13, topic:549463"][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=668364.msg4470340#msg4470340 date=1422634372]

Yes I consider it spoon feeding.

Nobody forced you to post your elite code mang. I suggest you read up on spoon feeding, or by suggesting that… I am spoon feeding? Anyways, you going to post those upgrades (you don’t have to go into any detail, just a general list, you can even pm this to lothy)
[/quote]
The walk to actions are using timed events to check if player is on the destination(it never crossed anybodys mind to check for that after moving the player?) :palm:. I don’t have enough time right now to list up more.[/quote]
Fair point. However checking for that after moving means you’re coupling the event to the player/npc, rather than making it independent. Still, it’s worth consideration and you mentioning it is an eye-opener.

Just so you know, decoupling RSCD from MINA and making use of Netty instead is a lot of work in its own right. Changing the way packets are written to the underlying socket is the same (i.e., from immediately writing each small packet to instead using one large pooled underlying buffer and then flushing it once per tick).

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:11, topic:549463”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=668364.msg4470339#msg4470339 date=1422634160]
Yes I consider it spoon feeding.
[/quote]

Nobody forced you to post your elite code mang. I suggest you read up on spoon feeding, or by suggesting that… I am spoon feeding? Anyways, you going to post those upgrades (you don’t have to go into any detail, just a general list, you can even pm this to lothy)[/quote]
Spoon feeding isn’t just about straight up giving the code, i it can also be giving step by step instructions(the solution) on doing something and giving the opponent no room to think for themselves.

The list would be fairly long but I can tell you that even the basic game mechanics of RSCD are wrong, things are handled at random times and sometimes that causes bugs, delay, and threading issues if you were to make it multi-threaded. The networking should be rewritten to like what Lothy has done on Elysium, but I would do things bit differently. The walk to actions are using timed events to check if player is on the destination(it never crossed anybodys mind to check for that after moving the player?) :palm:. I don’t have enough time right now to list up more.

Read full topic

item.title: Contributing to https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:9, topic:549463”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=668364.msg4470335#msg4470335 date=1422633354]

Well go ahead and list the “upgrades”

Fail community = fail community projects.

Or maybe the community is so shitty that nobody wants to contribute to it including me. I want you people to think yourself instead of being spoon fed like I did on your NPC AI thread.
[/quote]

Oh no, your 1 person out of the 7 here. Your comments on the AI thread did not spoon feed in anyway, as nothing you provided I used. As this section is for discussion, I posted it, if I were to post in the help section, then that might be a different story. Anyhow, are you going to list the “few upgrades” that would make rscd comparable? Or do you consider that list a spoon feed.[/quote]
Yes I consider it spoon feeding.

Read full topic
